messages.subject: Kelli 2yr old &baby sleep
messages.msgSnippet: Wish I could help with the two yr. old thing, it is a tuff age. One day when Cassidy pushed Nicholas down I just sat her down and told her that she is his
messages.messageBody:
Wish I could help with the two yr. old thing, it is a tuff age.
One day when Cassidy pushed Nicholas down I just sat her down and told her
that she is his sister and he loves her. That pushing him will hurt him and
that hurts his feelings. Yours is a bit young for reasoning. I would guess
that she is a bit jealous but what can you do? I often had my husband take
Cassidy some place special.

When Nicholas was nursing I had to sleep with him, he just would not sleep
without me. When we moved him to his crib I put something that smelled like
Mommy in there and he was fine after a couple days of reassuring him. He was
also an almost 10 pound baby smaller than my daughter at 11-9 and I knew his
between nursing would be almost like hers so if I wanted sleep they had to
sleep with me until they where done nursing. My children, well the last two
nursed so much I was told they where using me as a pacifier. They where
content, I got well needed sleep that's was important.
Sorry, im going in to this nursing thing and I dont even know if you are
nursing.
I will say that when I thought it would never happen it finally did. We where
at about 6 months when Nicholas went into his crib at night time.
Dont worry about what every one else does or says they do that's why we
Unschool right?

Laura
Maine


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
